means: 照自然状态，不成熟地，粗杂地

sentence.Network_en: In some places maps are scarce, and are often crudely produced.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些地方很少有地图，而且通常绘制得都很粗糙。

sentence.Network_en: One strut had fractured and been crudely repaired in several places.
sentence.Network_cn: 一根撑木出现了裂痕，有几处已进行了粗略的修补。

sentence.Network_en: Put crudely, the liberationists favour extending a number of rights to children.
sentence.Network_cn: 大致来说，妇女解放论者希望将一些权利延伸至儿童。

entry.def: A crude method or measurement is not exact or detailed, but may be useful or correct in a rough, general way.

example.ex: Standard measurements of blood pressure are an important but crude way of assessing the risk of heart disease or strokes...
example.tran: 标准的血压测量是评估患心脏病或中风几率的一个重要但不精确的方法。

example.ex: Birthplace data are only the crudest indicator of actual migration paths.
example.tran: 出生地信息只能非常粗略地显示实际移民过程。

entry.def: If you describe an object that someone has made as crude, you mean that it has been made in a very simple way or from very simple parts.

entry.tran: 冒犯的;粗鲁的;不精明的
entry.def: If you describe someone as crude, you disapprove of them because they speak or behave in a rude, offensive, or unsophisticated way.

example.ex: Nev! Must you be quite so crude?
example.tran: 尼夫！你非得那么粗俗吗？

entry.def: Crude substances are in a natural or unrefined state, and have not yet been used in manufacturing processes.
Crude is the same as crude oil .

means.word_mean: 1. in a crude or unrefined manner;
2. in a crude and unskilled manner;

auth_sentence.content: To put it crudely, our economy has been fracked up.

Sentence.sentence: I think they do better academically and you can measure that very crudely from the examination results,I also think they do better academically because they have more opportunities to take the leading role in discussions and in managerial responsibilities.
